column4: so you are connting the usb dongle directly to the linux box and its not connecting ... is that it?
the USB dongle is working fine but my home network (through router wired and wireless) is not connecting to internet, thought its working on windows
what i am trying to know is if the dongle is connected to some router or is it directly connected to some machine
its directly connected to ubuntu machine.

what should i do so that it works fine... when I installed ubuntu it was working perfectly fine... I configured it via NetworkManager with manual IPs it worked fine then too but when I rebooted the system it now doesn't connect !
what is your default gateway?
routers IP address is the default gateway : 10.10.10.1
check in network manager if your dns is configured
also let me know the response for "ping 8.8.8.8"
dns is configured in router itself so I put ip address same as routers in dns. and I have put openDNS ips in router for dns address.
so what is the outcome of nslookup and ping?
This is the output of ping its resolving the names to IPs but not able to exchange packets... tested with other sites also ... http://fpaste.org/Cubf/
there is something wrong with the routing on your box ... please help me with the output of "route -n"
http://paste.ubuntu.com/930656/
I again and again have to disconnect from home router to connect to internet... :(
10.10.10.0 is not a valid IP address for the netmask 255.255.255.0 ... changing the IP assigned to eth0 to may be 10.10.10.1 or something should do the trick
I am trying that
so its working now?
no man I am pasting the configuration details for my home network, please check it out if I am wrong somewhere.
where to paste screenshots ? I am not aware of !!! can you please let me know ?
do it the same way you were doing it before
